Reviews:
It surprisingly holds up great even now. The story itself is fairly basic, but there's fun world building and a whole lot of really unique characters. The animation is very solid and not stiff like one would expect from that era. Each mind you get to explore has a personal style themed to it and they explore wildly different ideas. Even some fun way of trying out your new powers with the scavenger hunt.

The only negative I have would be the mechanical side, movement and actions can feel clunky and not always working properly. And the audio quality not being fully consistent with some voice lines.

It will be interesting to see the improvements made in Psychonauts 2. You can really feel that this game was made with love and dedication, it oozes charm. | çok eğlenceli sıra dışı bir yapım TR yama da kurdum akıp gidiyor , çünkü az ingilizce yetmiyor oyun için kısmi platform oyunu ama hikayesi esprileri gayet ayarında yapılmış tavsiye ederim | Funny, quirky adventure.
Although the later stages might be annoying, the level designs are really fascinating.
This game has been on my backlog for almost 8 years; finally, I played it from beginning to end. | Psychonauts is a great game that has some of the best writing in the Video Game history BUT time also hasn't been very kind to this game in terms of control and combat.

Firstly, the games story, writing, voice acting, etc is all top notch and it has some of the best environmental storytelling out there (with exception to the sequel). Raz (the main protagonist) is a fantastic character and the voice job by Horvits is top notch. 

Graphically this game doesn't hold up too well and it's not for the art style. While the Art Style can definitely be divisive personally I think it's fine. It's later polished up and I think looks way better in the sequel but here it's fine if not a bit ugly at times. However the art style mixed with original xbox graphics and low resolution cut-scenes can make parts of the game just look bad and dated.

The real part that makes this game not be a masterpiece is the combat and to a lesser extent the movement. The combat is clunky and tough to get the hang of (another thing fixed in the sequel). The movement is fine but the Levitation ability is completely overpowered which while fun completely negates a lot of the platforming challenge.

The games world and main hub (whispering rock psychic summer camp) is charming and fun to explore but the first levels or minds can feel very tutorialized making the start of the game one of the weakest if you're not fully exploring the hub. The game really picks up halfway when the story pivots to its main objective (not to spoil anything) and takes you away from the camp to really go into the best minds in the game. Sadly the final level is a mess. It's not this super insane challenging level it got over time but it's way tougher than the rest of the game and the bad and clunky combat makes it a frustrating chore.

Overall you play the original Psychonauts for the incredible story, fun word, and cleaver writing and not the combat/platforming. If you do pick this up (which I recommend if you're interested) be prepare to endure some dated gameplay to get to the parts that made this game a cult classic.

8/10 - Infinite | Fantastic game. Contains somewhat dated jokes but that's a time capsule of the era if anything. Varied levels, enjoyable dialogue with various characters. I recommend playing this, and it goes on dirt cheap sales as well. So wishlist it if anything :)

There are few games that manage to transcend their medium, leaving a lasting impact on the players who experience them. Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines is one of those rare gems—an immersive, darkly compelling RPG that takes you deep into a world of nightmarish intrigue, complex morality, and unforgettable characters. Released in 2004, it may have been ahead of its time, but it has since become a beloved classic, and for good reason. This is a game that not only captures the spirit of its source material but builds a world so rich, so nuanced, that it feels alive.

A World of Shadows and Secrets
From the moment you step into the shoes of a freshly turned vampire, Bloodlines introduces you to a world that is both beautifully sinister and intricately detailed. Set in modern-day Los Angeles, the game weaves a dark tale of political intrigue, personal conflict, and supernatural terror. The rich lore of the Vampire: The Masquerade tabletop RPG is brought to life in an almost seamless way, with each faction of vampires—whether it's the stoic Ventrue, the cunning Malkavians, or the fiery Brujah—adding layers of complexity to the story. This is a world where nothing is ever simple, and where every decision you make carries weight.

The setting itself, the urban sprawl of LA, is a masterwork of gothic atmosphere. The game’s locations—be it the seedy alleyways of Santa Monica or the terrifying depths of the haunted asylum—are meticulously crafted, with a level of detail that makes every corner feel like it holds a secret. You’re not just moving through a city; you’re navigating a sprawling, living ecosystem of power struggles and hidden threats.

Immersive Role-Playing Like No Other
What truly sets Bloodlines apart from other RPGs is its depth of character interaction and role-playing opportunities. The game is all about choice—and not just in how you approach combat or quests, but in how you choose to live your life as a vampire. Will you uphold the delicate balance of the Masquerade, hiding your true nature from humanity, or will you embrace your monstrous side and sow chaos? These choices aren’t just for show; they impact the way you’re treated by the various factions, your relationships with other characters, and even the game’s ending. There are no easy answers here, and that’s what makes it so compelling.

The character creation system is robust, allowing you to craft a vampire that fits your playstyle. You can invest in a variety of abilities, from brutal physical combat to stealthy persuasion and hacking skills. The power of your clan also plays a significant role in how you approach different challenges, and the supernatural abilities you gain as a vampire offer a variety of ways to approach problems. Whether you want to manipulate minds, become a fearsome force in combat, or sneak past enemies unnoticed, Bloodlines gives you the freedom to build your vampire exactly how you envision them.

A Story That Binds You
But it’s not just the gameplay that shines—it’s the narrative. Bloodlines offers a gripping, multi-layered story that is filled with moral ambiguity, unforgettable characters, and moments of genuine emotional weight. Whether you're trying to navigate the political machinations of the vampire factions or diving into a personal quest that challenges your own morals, the plot is constantly shifting and evolving. The main story is full of twists and turns, but it’s the side stories—the personal journeys of the NPCs—that really elevate the game. These characters are deeply written and full of life, each with their own motivations, quirks, and tragic backstories.

The voice acting is phenomenal, bringing every character to life with nuances and emotions that make them feel real. Whether you’re talking to a wise old vampire or a desperate fledgling, the dialogue is always engaging and never feels forced. The writing, sharp and often darkly humorous, helps bring out the personality of every character you encounter, from the charming yet treacherous LaCroix to the lovable, eccentric hacker, Jeanette.

Combat and Gameplay Mechanics
The combat system in Bloodlines is a bit divisive, but it offers a unique approach to RPG combat. While the shooting mechanics can feel clunky at times, the game’s strength lies in its flexibility. You can choose to avoid combat altogether, relying on your social skills to navigate tense situations or solve problems through dialogue and subterfuge. But when the fighting does come, the visceral action makes you feel the power of being a vampire, whether you’re tearing through enemies with claws or using dark blood magic to overwhelm your foes.

The game also offers a range of side quests that are surprisingly rich in content, giving you more than just a diversion from the main story. Whether you’re helping a fellow vampire find their lost item or delving into a creepy mystery, these quests help flesh out the world and deepen your immersion.

A Timeless Classic
Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines is a game that continues to stand the test of time. Despite its technical issues at launch—many of which were patched over the years—the story, world-building, and complex characters remain as captivating as ever. This is a game that rewards patience, allowing you to sink hours into its rich narrative and immersive world. It’s a rare gem that doesn't just entertain, but challenges you, makes you think, and makes you feel the weight of every choice.

In a gaming landscape often dominated by shallow experiences, Bloodlines is a deep, meaningful RPG that still feels like a living, breathing world full of possibilities. It’s a game that hooks you with its dark allure and doesn’t let go. If you haven’t experienced Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines yet, you owe it to yourself to dive into this haunting, unforgettable adventure.

In short: an essential masterpiece, where darkness and storytelling converge into something truly special. | The most sheer aura per square-meter ever put into an rpg. Already craving for something with a similar feel but there really just isn't, shame the sequel seems to be going downhill. 

Btw if you love the setting as much as i did go check out some of the other World Of Darkness stuff (Mage is a personal fav) and delve into the lore, you're in for helluva good time. | Trust me and download the unofficial patch before starting a save, it could save you hours of gameplay being lost like me.

Combat is pretty not good but everything else is pretty very very good. | О старый играх с культовым статусом говорить сложно, в особенности в той ситуации, когда в самом популярном онлайн-магазине в лице Стима продается едва играбельная версия сабжа, которую, по факту, рекомендовать не стоит, хотя бы по причине того, что в Гоге вам предложат купить то же самое, но с фанатским патчем (хоть и базовым) из коробки и раза в три дешевле (если учитывая скидки на текущий момент). Но окей, я буду соблюдать Маскарад вместе с остальными старперами тут, нарисую "синий" отзыв и скажу то, что говорят все: [u][b]"Таких игр сейчас не делают"[/b][/u].

Иронично, что дотянулся я до игры недавно: по факту, уже после знакомства с НРИ-оригиналом, я накатил базовый патч, проглотил эту вкусняшку за Тореадора, потом еще одну порцию с расширенным за Малкавиана, облизал ложечку и попросил добавки, и все потому, что соус из фанатской поддержки все делает едой, не иначе. И сижу с невыразимой тоской на физиономии, ведь "раньше было лучше".

Помимо технического состояния, поругать игру есть за что. Но есть одно "но": такую игру даже близко днем с огнем не сыщешь, особенно на крупнобюджетной сцене. Это просто шедеврище, с уютными небольшими локациями, уймой запоминающихся персонажей и квестов, необычной механикой развития персонажа и многими другими прелестями и, как ни банально, жирной, стекающей с экрана атмосферой. А музыка-то какая, дорогие каиниты! В клубе Asp Hole можно часами сидеть, слушая один и тот же трек Tiamat. Отдельная конфетка - общая глубина некоторых аспектов игры; так, выбор клана буквально может целиком поменять примерно все ощущение от процесса. Повторю уже знакомую многим рекомендацию: в первый раз играйте кем угодно, КРОМЕ Малка, чтобы во второй раз пойти именно за него. Под Малкавиана переписаны все диалоги в игре, но знаете, что самое классное? Это крайне редкий опыт выбора между "притворяться пришибленным" и "быть пришибленным". И это просто восхитительно.  

Игра - это здоровский трип в начало нулевых, когда мы сами были мелкотой, и наши родители старательно соблюдали свой Маскарад, чтобы не показывать нам мрачные элементы тогдашней жизни, из-за чего не самые спокойные и благополучные времена овеяны ностальгией; и вот, мы сами теперь взрослые, и теперь нам тоже придется придерживаться этого Маскарада - уже для наших младших, детей, племянников и прочих, чтобы и они вошли в свой взрослый возраст с теплыми воспоминаниями о прошлом... А мы будем запускать всякое офигенное старье и недовольно ворчать на современные игры.

P.s. Обязательный дисклеймер: ОТДЕЛЬНО ОТМЕЧУ - стимовская версия сломана целиком и полностью. Если вы все же решитесь брать ее тут [strike]Б-г вам судья[/strike] - готовьтесь идти в руководства за ссылками на патчи. А еще можете сверху навернуть перевод и русскую озвучку (довольно приличную, btw). | Paradox's CEO calling this game a "competently good game by 2004 standards" is absolutely insane. I've played this for the 1st time in 2025 and its easily one of the best RPG's I've ever played. I don't have much hope for the sequel coming out later this year but I definitely recommend the OG to new players. Just make sure to download the unofficial patch.

A classic immersive RPG with phenomenal sound and ambience, decent melee combat, and an epic (albeit perhaps a little janky) magic and casting system. It would've been better if a few parts of the world were a little bit more fleshed out, such as the remains of the dwarven kingdom, and the world and its characters were more reactive to your actions in general, but still, what is there is quite good. | Arx Fatalis - Игра моего детства 
Игра, которая без преувеличения изменила мою жизнь 
Игра, в которой даже спустя столько лет я нахожу что-то новое
Игра, забытый и неповторимый бриллиант среди прочих игр своего жанра
Игра, не получившая продолжения, но повлиявшая на другие игры, типа Dark Messiah, Dishonored и другие.
Игра.. нет, это не игра, Arx Fatalis это жизнь, которая навсегда останется в моих сердце и душе.

В этой игре нет огромного и открытого мира, зато этот небольшой игровой мир очень насыщен и компактен.
Здесь нет столь обширного лора, как к примеру в играх серии TES, зато изучив несколько книг в библиотеках,  ты поймёшь большую часть информации о событиях до и после.
Здесь нет привычной рпг системы с вариантами в диалогах, ведь ты и твои поступки - вот показатель твоего персонажа.
Здесь нет автолевелинга, зато при должной сноровке, будучи голым бомжом с папкой, тебе будет под силу перебить всю стражу.
Только в Арксе, более нигде мне не доводилось видеть столь уникальную и сложную магию, приходится вручную чертить и изучать руны.
Это та игра, которая поощряет эксперименты, а вы знали, что если применить на золотое колечко зелье невидимости/лечения, а затем зачаровать, то получится зачарованное кольцо с эффектами тех зелий, знали??

Об этой легендарной игре я могу рассказывать очень долго, и я очень рекомендую её к покупке и ознакомлению всем любителям хороших игр | Очень даже годно. Интересная система магии, когда её нужно рисовать мышкой, и интересные Квесты, когда тебя не ведут за ручку и не говорят, что тебе делать. Один из лучших моих экспириенсов в играх того времени. Вот её я точно когда нибудь перепройду) настоятельно советую! | Probably one of the most unique fantasy settings in existence.
Probably the most unique magic casting mechanic in videogaming.
If hand-crafted feel and experimental originality can beat out polished refinedness for you, this one is for you.
It's quite old, so it obviously won't blow anyone's socks off graphically, but the specifics of the setting ameliorate any technical limitations of the engine. As an upside it'll run on a potato.
Sadly, if you're gonna be playing this on anything other than a potato, you'll need a community port to run it at modern resolutions (beyond 1080p) - Arx Libertatis has your back there.

Regrettably, the maintainers of the port use some 3rd party launcher that pings antiviruses though. If you're afraid of the antivirus notification, and are running a modern system, you can just extract the x64 binaries (or the x86 ones if you're running a potato) from the port's folder structure and avoid the launcher - truly baffling decision by the port maintainers. | Arx Fatalis é um RPG de ação em primeira pessoa lançado em 2002 pela Arkane Studios. O jogo se passa em um mundo subterrâneo, onde os habitantes foram forçados a viver após o sol começar a morrer. A história combina mistérios, profecias e exploração, com o jogador assumindo o papel de um herói amnésico destinado a impedir o retorno de um deus maligno chamado Akbaa.  

A jogabilidade é o grande destaque, oferecendo liberdade de escolhas e um mundo altamente interativo. Você pode explorar, criar itens, cozinhar e resolver quebra-cabeças. O sistema de magia é inovador, exigindo que o jogador desenhe runas na tela para conjurar feitiços, o que adiciona profundidade, mas pode ser frustrante em combate intenso. Há também opções para combate direto ou abordagens furtivas, permitindo que cada jogador encontre seu próprio estilo.  

O design dos níveis é interconectado e utiliza bem a verticalidade, criando um senso de exploração recompensador. A atmosfera é rica, com uma ambientação sombria que reforça o sentimento de isolamento. Apesar disso, os gráficos e o combate podem parecer datados para padrões modernos, e a falta de um sistema de mapa mais intuitivo pode ser desafiadora para novos jogadores.  

Mesmo com suas limitações técnicas, *Arx Fatalis* é um jogo que cativa pela profundidade e criatividade, sendo considerado um marco nos "simuladores imersivos". Ele influenciou jogos posteriores da Arkane, como *Dishonored* e *Prey*, e continua relevante graças à sua comunidade de fãs e ao projeto *Arx Libertatis*, que modernizou o jogo para sistemas atuais.  

Nota: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆  
Recomendado para quem busca uma experiência nostálgica, focada em imersão e exploração, e não se importa com algumas mecânicas antiquadas.

Hexen: Beyond Heretic does a lot to separate itself from all the other games on the Doom engine, including its predecessor. While Hexen is perhaps best known for its confusing switch and key puzzles, a lot of these complaints overstate the level of complexity in them. What is, on the other hand, often understand is the repetitiveness of the combat due the lack of enemy variety and small number of weapons. While Hexen does have its faults, it is ultimately worth a shot for most classic FPS fans.

PROS:
- Creative art style that build upon Heretic with impressive environmental effects
- Expansive list of unique items
- Mostly solid level design
- Great length, taking around 7 hours to complete

CONS:
- DosBox port, look at installing with GZDoom
- The small number of weapons and enemies make combat extremely repetitive and slow
- Some sections can be confusing and may require a guide | Exen, un classico degli sparatutto in prima persona, ha un gameplay solido e un'ambientazione dark fantasy coinvolgente; tuttavia, la grafica datata e i controlli un po' rigidi possono risultare meno attraenti per i giocatori odierni.

Inoltre, la variaietà delle armi e la possibilità di scegliere tra tre classi diverse aggiungono si profondità al gameplay, ma la storia potrebbe sembrare un po' scarna.

L'atmosfera è uno dei punti di forza di Exen, con livelli ben progettati e una colonna sonora coinvolgente, ma l'intelligenza artificiale nemica può risultare un po' prevedibile a lungo andare. | All these sprites should be printed out and put on display in a museum!

Game Name: Hexen: Deathkings of the Dark Citadel
Reviews:
Hexen: Deathking of the Dark Citadel does nothing to distinguish itself as anything more than a poor map pack. In fact, the level design is a significant downgrade, and with no new weapons or enemies, there is no real reason to play this (other than to be a completionist). In short, the strengths of the base game are largely missing and the weaknesses are amplified.

PROS:
- Great art style from the base game
- Fun items from the base game

CONS:
- DosBox port, look at installing with GZDoom
- By the middle of the expansion it becomes clear that there is nothing new and the same few encounters will be repeated for its duration
- Poor level design, perhaps more confusing than the base game | I mean it's an expansion to Hexen, one of the best FPS games ever created. It's a definite buy if you enjoy these original Boomer Shooters!

Game Name: Heretic: Shadow of the Serpent Riders
Reviews:
Heretic takes place in a dark fantasy world where you play as Corvus, a surviving Sindhe whose homeland was invaded by the Serpent Riders and their minions.  Despite all the odds, you persist through desolate cities, cathedrals, tombs, hallways, towers, domes and dungeons surrounded by darkness, lava or even layers of water.  The first three episodes were really good but the bonus two episodes can be somewhat difficult and time-consuming.  The music is fantastic throughout the game that fits the atmosphere.  The weapons came in a variety and equip different types of ammo (e.g. crystals, bows, orbs and runes) but can be amplified if you use the book of tome.   The power-ups were helpful and can be manipulated to your advantage.  The enemies range from size, appearance and strength in a similar fashion to Doom besides this game was made with the doom engine with some extra modifications.    This game is enjoyable and can be enjoyed by people who love fantasy games or first person shooters.  It deserves to be up there with Doom, it's legacy cannot be denied.

Overall Rating: 10/10 | 78/100

I recommend playing this game using the GZDoom thing. There is a nice, easy to follow guide in the Steam community tab to set you up.

Visually and enemy wise it can get very samey but it's charming and the map layouts are interesting. DOOM without guns. | [b]Cień Wężowego Jeźdźca[/b]
Heretic: Shadow of the Serpent Riders to gra, która wyłaniała się z cienia Doom'a, który (zaraz po Wolfenstein 3D) definiował gatunek pierwszoosobowych strzelanek. Jest różnorodnie, jest ciekawie i jest wymagająco. Przyznam, że nie mogłem się oprzeć i całość przechodziłem w jaknajbardziej klasyczny sposób, tj. bez żadnych "nowoczesnych" modyfikacji, w rozdzielczości 800x600 i posługując się wyłącznie klawiaturą - to niewątpliwie podnosi poziom wyzwania, ale pokonywanie tak kolejnych przeszkód daje mnóstwo frajdy! Shadow of the Serpent Riders dodaje dodatkowe dwa rozdziały do tego, co oferował Heretic z 1994.
[b]Archaiczny schemat[/b]
Sama obsługa gry nie jest aż tak intuicyjna jak by się mogło wydawać. Po pierwsze, w tle menu, po krótkim odczekaniu, odpala się zapis rozgrywki. Generalnie, ciekawe rozwiązanie, problem w tym, że mocno ogranicza to czytelność opcji. Kolejna kwestia to wybór poziomu, raz w rozumieniu aktu, dwa, poziomu trudności. O ile lista jasno przedstawia hierarchię tychże, o tyle ciekawie robi się gdy któryś z tych epizodów ukończymy, bo oto zamiast przejść automatycznie do następnego, zgodnego ze ścieżką fabularną, gra stoi, czekając na Nasz ruch - wywołanie menu. Każdy akt musimy uruchamiać jako "Nowa gra" i samodzielnie wskazać kolejny epizod.
[b]Podstarzała kompozycja[/b]
Odnośnie oprawy to jestem rozdarty. Z jednej strony wspaniała warstwa oprawy dźwiękowej wzbudza uzasadnione emocje, świetnie pozwala orientować się w sytuacji ucząc Nas odgłosów konkretnych maszkar, dźwięków odsłanianych przejść czy po prostu towarzysząc Nam w odkrywaniu kolejnych niebezpiecznych miejsc. No ale z drugiej strony mamy oprawę graficzną i ta, w obecnych czasach, jest już mało satysfakcjonująca. "Pikseloza" jest i nie ma co tego ukrywać, ale głównym zarzutem tutaj jest przede wszystkim paleta barw, bo ta sprawia, że (szczególnie) "brązowi" przeciwnicy są często niemal niewidoczni. Podobnie wszelkiego rodzaju załomki czy ocena poziomu gruntu pozwalającego pokonać tę czy inną przeszkodę jest bardzo utrudniona - tu zlewa się za dużo elementów. Ale poza tym, różnorodność etapów i pomysłowość Twórców wypadałoby solidnie pochwalić, bo choćby takie rwące rzeki czy "wodne" ściany wyglądają świetnie a np. subtelne różnice w zawieszonych proporcach wyraźnie wskazują, którą ścianę należy zmacać.
[b]Skomplikowany plan pola walki[/b]
Każda plansza jest bardzo złożonym tworem. Każda jest też, na koniec etapu, opisana statystykami ilości potworów, ilości przedmiotów oraz sekretami. Te czynniki sprawia, że ich eksploracja nabiera sensu nie tylko w czysto pragmatycznym podejściu znalezienia wyjścia, ale również pod względem zaspokajania ciekawości odkrywców. Plansze skrywają mnóstwo tajnych przejść czy wind, które nie są zrobione na jedno kopyto. O ile kolorowe klucze i otwierane nimi kolejne sekcje etapu są oczywiste, o tyle zdarzają się przełączniki naścienne, płyty naciskowe, "luźne" ściany, imitacje ścian (wygląda jak ściana ale swobodnie można przez nią przechodzić) czy takie, których otwarcie wymaga ataku. Tak duże urozmaicenie powinno być bardzo satysfakcjonujące, ale zdarza się, że potrafi zirytować gdy po usłyszeniu charakterystycznego dźwięku, trących o siebie kamiennych płyt, nie wiemy co właśnie zostało uruchomione. Mimo że etapy można zazwyczaj ukończyć do kilkunastu minut (przy 95% czyszczenia mapy) to problemy z lokalizacją otwartego przejścia, czy (głównie) z lokalizacją samego przełącznika, mogą Naszą rozgrywkę mocno wydłużyć.
[b]Wyczerpująca lista niezbędnych narzędzi[/b]
A czemu odkrywanie plansz jest tu tak dobre? Przede wszystkim dlatego, że odpowiednio wczesne zdobycie specjalnych przedmiotów czy broni pozwala swobodniej manewrować w końcowej fazie wybranego epizodu. Broni jest dużo bo aż 8. Mimo że duża część bazuje na wystrzeliwanych, z różną prędkością, pociskach, to każda ma tu swoje miejsce. Do tego dochodzą przedmioty znacząco urozmaicając rozgrywkę. Od pomocnych mikstur leczenia, po umiejętność latania czy czasową nieśmiertelność aż do księgi, której użycie modyfikuje ataki Naszych "giwer" zmieniając np. "feniksową rakietnicę" w "miotacz ognia".
[b]Rozszerzony spis armii Jeźdźca[/b]
Żeby korzystanie z przedmiotów/broni było odpowiednio satysfakcjonujące, mamy całkiem ciekawy zestaw przeciwników. Ci potrafią zaskoczyć nie tylko wyłaniając się z za ściany, ale choćby i tym, że część z nich, mimo analogicznej aparycji ma swoje różne wersje. Ot początkowe czerwonoskóre gargulce czy bladobrązowe golemy. W początkowych fazach mierzymy się w większości z osobnikami walczącymi w zwarciu, korzystającymi odpowiednio z pazurów czy pięści. Ale dalsza przygoda odsłoni przed Nami warianty tych stworzeń, które potrafią wysłać w Naszą stronę ogniste pociski. Co więcej, golemy występują również w wersji eterycznej (półprzeźroczyści i odporni na część ataków). Do całej puli maszkar dochodzą jeszcze te, których poznamy w Bardziej Osobistych Starciach Specjalnych czyli Żelazny Licz, Masakrotaur i sam Wężowy Jeździec. Co symptomatyczne dla wielu gier, w Hereticu "pierwsi" więksi przeciwnicy powracają również w kolejnych etapach jako "szeregowi" przeciwnicy. Walka nie należy zatem do najprostszych i choć mamy tu "autonamierzanie" Naszych pocisków, to nie jest to coś, co pozwala Nam brnąć pewnie przed siebie. Ciekawe jest również to, że różne "rasy" potrafią walczyć pomiędzy sobą.
[b]Czas skazać heretyka na odświeżenie![/b]
Heretic jest zdecydowanie wymagający, ale odpowiednio dawkuje poziom trudności. Ma swoje bolączki związane z graficznym przedstawieniem świata i ograniczeniami sterowania, ale nadal jest to bardzo dobrze wykonana gra. Nawet dziś przy tych ograniczeniach mam satysfakcję po jej ukończeniu. Zamiast zapowiadanego DOOM: The Dark Ages wolałbym odświeżonego Heretica w sposób analogiczny do Dooma (2016). | Heretic, uno sparatutto in prima persona ambientato in un mondo dark fantasy, brilla per il suo arsenale variegato e i livelli intricati con segreti da scoprire; tuttavia, può risultare meno coinvolgente a causa di una trama poco sviluppata e delle meccaniche di gioco simili ad altri titoli del genere.

L'atmosfera è ben curata, con ambientazioni che trasmettono un senso di mistero e pericolo, e il multiplayer aggiunge longevità, ma la difficoltà può essere frustrante per chi è meno esperto.

Senza dubbio, il design delle armi è creativo, offrendo un arsenale magico unico nel suo genere, mentre la colonna sonora contribuisce all'immersione nel mondo di gioco.

Gioco che fa storcere il naso al giocatore odierno ma consigliato per i fan del genere. | Very good to remember the old times when I was a kid.

It is really hard to recommend HeXen II. There are a few moments where everything clicks and the game is great, but the majority of this campaign is a pain to get through. Put simply, the puzzles are confusing and offer little to no direction while the combat is extremely one note. Unfortunately, unlike Heretic and the first Hexen, HeXen II is just not worth the pain and suffering.

PROS:
- Great art style and impressive graphics for the Quake engine
- Fun item system
- Decent length, taking around 6 - 10 hours to complete (depending on your use of a guide)

CONS:
- Terrible port that will need some configuration
- Puzzles are excruciating and ambiguous, a guide is a necessity
- Mana is far too rare for what the game expects
- Enemies have far too much health and engagements become a test of when the player runs out of mana, rather than true difficulty
- Missing the Portal of Praevus expansion

 | Hexen II is the videogame version of an instrumental interlude of a Black Metal demo from the 90s, limited to 666 cassettes.

I was 12 when it was released, and I fell in love immediately. It has that raw, unrefined touch of demonic dark-fantasy from all early Raven Software titles, long before they started to release generic / uninteresting stuff like the same CoD crap over and over again. It uses a modified version of the Quake engine, and at that time the graphics were awesome: Rich textures, detailed models, destructible environments, etc. The music is also excellent, now it would be considered vintage Dungeon Synth and it would sell well on Bandcamp. It has some RPG elements but it's basically an FPS. You get satanic shit everywhere, and enemies straight out of the ninth circle of Hell, what else do you want?

HOWEVER I wouldn't recommend buying the Steam version, as it doesn't include the original CD music, and the mouse support is limited (no free look in all directions, only left and right). I bought the GOG version too, and I am playing that one instead, it's much better in my opinion. | An absolute classic from it's time, with modern computer the only annoying part of the old experience (the loading time between the areas) is gone and it's pure fun.
I believe it was one of the best uses of the old quake engine, having RPG elements and medieval fantasy in a FPS game. The technology might be outdated now, but the experience is ahead of its time. | War mit Duke Nukem eins meiner ersten und liebsten Games <3 Heute auch noch geil zum spielen | Daha iyisi gelmez bundan da kötüsü o eski günler gelmez be

Para quem ama musicas e jogos vai amar esse gamer uma mistura maravilhosa !!!


Você pode tocar enquanto ouve suas músicas favoritas !!!


O jogo é fácil, simples e muito viciante, 9 em cada 10 sempre podem haver melhorias, mas até agora este jogo é incrível. | It is good for a few days until suddenly you find everything in the menu is all white and can't play the game whatsoever | Me and my buddies couldn't get enough of this game in years past. | Yeah whatever.

Can't help thinking it's just like someone paying for a fancy Winamp visualisation. But if that's your bag.

As someone who doesn't use spotify or whatever, and has always had a folder of all my music on my secondary drive since the 1990's even, I have no issues with lack of features. | Does not work with win11 pro. QuestViewer  issue.

Game Name: The Witcher: Enhanced Edition Director's Cut
Reviews:
I bought all 3 Witcher games as part of a bundle, and played them chronologically with no previous experience with the series. Boy, am I glad I trudged through this.
While the gameplay is janky and graphics a little lackluster (by 2020 standards, I'm a spoiled bih), I remain impressed by the depth of the writing and how the choices you makes reflect on the npcs around you.
If you're going into the Witcher for story, highly recommend buying and playing, especially since it goes on sale so often. The Witcher is a rare series that gets exponentially better with each release, so I feel that having the knowledge of 1 going into 2 really helped elevate the experience. 3 stole my heart and refuses to give it back.

Would I play this game again?
Hell naw. But I'm glad I did it. | Este jogo é incrível, mas não é para todos, ele possui uma complexidade tática única, o que vai faz muita gente achar ele difícil quando na verdade se você usar a estratégia certa ele fica relativamente fácil.

[b]Jogue este o jogo se você:[/b]
[list]
[*] Gosta de Leitura.
[*] Gosta de RPG.
[*] Gosta de explorar.
[*] Gosta de Jogos com características táticas complexas.
[*] Gosta de jogos clássicos como os primeiros Dark Souls e Neverwinter Nights.
[*] Tem disposição para coletar e craftar itens.
[/list]

[b]Evite este jogo se:[/b]
[list]
[*] Não gosta de Leitura, (Há muita coisa para ler no jogo)
[*] Não gosta de RPG ou escolhas complexas.
[*] Não gosta de ficar perdendo tempo falando com todos npcs e entrando em todos os lugares.
[*] Gosta apenas de lutar metendo a espada nos inimigos sem frescuras como magia e alquimia.
[*] Não gosta de jogos datados ou com jogabilidade estranha.
[*] Não quer perder tempo coletando e craftando itens.
[/list]

[b]Alquimia[/b]

O uso de poções não é opcional, é OBRIGATÓRIO. Neste jogo você precisa coletar itens como plantas e partes de animais, comprar e ler formulas para poções e óleos, crafta-los e usar de acordo com o contexto, inimigo e sua estratégia. Essas informações custam caro no jogo, tanto em tempo conversando com npcs quanto em ouro para comprar as formulas. 

[b]Inimigos e Combates[/b]

A parte mais divertida para mim e mais odiada para outros. No jogo você possui uma espada de prata e uma de aço, além de 3 estilos de combate, você precisa usar a arma certa no estilo de combate certo contra o inimigo certo, e juntamente com isso combinar a magia e alquimia para explorar as fraquezas dos adversários, isso é fundamental especialmente nos chefes. 

Os pontos fracos dos monstros e chefes do jogo também não são de graça, você precisa comprar livros, e falar com npcs para descobri-los, o que você pode facilmente perder durante a progressão do game ou simplesmente ficar sem dinheiro para adquirir as informações, deixando o game mais difícil e menos rico em termos de lore. De posse da informação você precisa ficar consultado o codex do jogo para elaborar as estratégias de combate. 

As coisas não explicitas no codex, por exemplo, ele diz que o chefe do primeiro capitulo é pouco vulnerável a magia Aard, se você se deu o trabalho de aprender ou usar a magia Aard em combate sabe que ela tonteia os inimigos possibilitando que você os mate com um só golpe. 

De posse dessas duas informações você pode elaborar a estratégia de fortalecer o Aard para matar o chefe "super difícil" do capitulo 1 com apenas um golpe.  Mas cabe ao jogador chegar nesta conclusão e planejar com antecedência. Parece algo simples mas a maioria dos jogadores não o fazem pois jogam irrefletidamente. [b]The Witcher não vai te pegar pela mão. cabe a você pegar os insumos que o jogo te oferece para ter uma boa experiência[/b].

[b]História[/b]

A lore da série witcher dispensa comentários, só não posso deixar de mencionar que em diversos momentos o jogo tem coloca entre escolhas morais de fritar a cabeça. Você sempre se pega tentando entender qual a coisa certa até se dar conta que no jogo não existe isto de coisa certa, e que ninguém é inocente.

Uma coisa importante é que a história avança de forma inesperada, é normal coisas ficarem para trás na primeira jogada, sempre tenha isso em mente ao entrar em um lugar ou completar uma quest, as vezes o jogo avança e algumas quests não podem ser completadas, outras o jogador acaba deixando passar. Desta forma o jogo tem um valor alta para quem for re-jogar. | Après avoir fini le jeu en 63h, je ne peux que le recommander.

Certes, il n'est plus au goût du jour, mais n'oublions pas qu'il date de 2008 : 

-  la fluidité des mouvements n'est pas celle d'un jeu de 2019 
-  la réactivité peut parfois être légèrement ennuyante (dégainer 3 plombes après le début du combat) 

Et pour ceux/celles qui n'aiment pas faire des allers-retours pour une quête, qui n'aiment pas prendre le temps de dialoguer pour récolter un maximum d'informations, passer votre chemin ! Par ailleurs, c'est un RPG ... il faut bien s'y attendre.  

Cependant, il reste immersif et on se laisse prendre au jeu ... et puis ... toute trilogie ne commence-t-elle pas par le 1e épisode si l'on veut en comprendre l'histoire complète ?   

N'hésitez plus ...

Sans compter que 1,19€ pour 63h de jeu (soit 0.018€ / h) ... 

Bon, allez ... GO pour "The Witcher 2" !!! | The Witcher 3で初めてこのゲームタイトルを知りました。
３は本当に楽しませてもらい、物語をもっと深く知りたかったので
今回The Witcher 1の購入に踏み切りました。

安かったのもあり動いたらラッキー程度の感覚でしたが、なんとこのゲーム、windows10で動きます。
wikiにある日本語化MODもまだ生きているので驚きの連続でした。

windows10で動作するのかどうかが気がかりで、パーッと調べても答えが出てこなかったので、
このレビューが皆様の役に立つことを願っております。

ちなみにThe Witcher 2も、windows10で動作します。

 | A rough gem with an awesome story and a wonky/horrible combat system. Worthy for rpg fans and people who do not mind a bit of an old school jank

Если не стараться получить OCD, а просто играть - весьма приятная и не сложная головоломка | It is said that simple things amuse simple minds, and in the realm of video games, I certainly have a simple mind. That said, this is in the top 10 games that I've ever played on Steam. So simple, and yet the challenge ascends at a perfect tempo. The replayability is second to none! I'd recommend everyone who has never played this game to give it a try! | World of Goo 2 - вышла в EGS в 2024г.
А первую прошел когда она только вышла..
 | A brilliance in puzzle design back when puzzles were rarely using jello physics (look it up).

I prefer the mobile version because there is a extra degree of challenge by misplacing with touch.  Makes it funner if you enjoy fun via frustration.  Some do.

Yep, these guys also predicted some of the issues the modern gaming industry has normalized.  For that alone, I recommend. | Черные колобки говорили мне терпеть! 
И я терпел!

serinin 2. oyunu özellikler aynı hikaye biraz daha geniş ama ilk oyunun tadını vermedi gerilim hat safhada | "Black Plague" is a continuation of the first "Overture" game of Penumbra. Continue your journey through the mines deep under the snowy land of Greenland and reveal its dark and terrifying secrets what's burred in there. Have you got enough of the spirit to survive? | Massive improvement over Overture, featuring almost zero direct combat! A direct sequel to the aformentioned game. Story is, as always, amazing while everything else is alright at most.
Also: I have no idea how the laser disarm minigame works, randomly hitting buttons seems to work but I don't think it's the inteded solution.


Bonus - Penumbra: Requiem review.
I wouldn't recommend playing requiem unless you really like puzzles, like, REALLY like puzzles. It does not add much, if anything, to the story. Also, Requiem is not scary, as in, it doesn't try to be. So if you expect it to be another stealth oriented horror game with puzzles like the previous titles, don't. | A perfect sequel that addressed the shortcomings of Overture and exceeded my expectations. | Absolute classic in the horror / mystery genre. Rock solid story that really captures the imagination. Must play for anyone who likes paranormal / creepy PC games.

It's a short expansion for the Black Plague focused mainly on puzzles, which are mostly fun and not too difficult. The main thing which made me keep moving forward was to find out how the Penumbra story ends.

The atmosphere is little bit ruined by the fact that the levels have no logical connection to each other and the it all feels like a series of random puzzle levels. Also, the first person platforming sucks.

If it weren't for the story, I probably wouldn't recommend it. | Only play if you want to know more of the story and what happened to Philip, otherwise it's just a Portal game lacking all the survival elements of the previous games. | Weakest game in the trilogy. Repetitive puzzles, and very little storytelling. A twist ending makes it worthwhile, though. I finished it in under 3 hours. Play this if you're desperate for more Penumbra, but don't expect much. | Игра которая не нужна и вобще не понятно зачем была выпущена и разработана.
Не идет ни в какое сравнение с первыми двумя частями, Реквием - это просто набор душных головоломок в котором мы каждый уровень ищем МИКРОФОНЫ попутно нам выдают комментарий, которые пришиты белыми нитками к игре.
Хоррорной части -больше нет, атмосферы больше нет, сюжета больше нет, просто набор уровней.

Если играете в серию, просто закончите на второй игре в этой части НЕТ никакого продвижения по сюжету, все что есть это бэд трип на подобие ластовых лок во второй части.
 | It's taking a different turn from the previous games.
There's no more survival horror, story progression is completely lacking. It's more like an epiloque that wraps up everything from the previous games, rather than a sequel.
This game invested a lot more in puzzles, which are actually creative and challenging, but it wasn't what I was expecting from a Penumbra game.

One of the most recognisable of its kind - "Penumbra" is a story-driven horror game which challenges your mind and body both.

"Death is the final unknown". Yes? | 1. şahıs bakış açısıyla gizem gerilim oyunu , oyun kendini merak ettiriyor eski bir oyun olmasına rağmen oynanış güzel keyifli oyun | Only worth it for the story. Combat is clunky and tedious.

Cool to see where Amnesia series got all its genes from. | A shitty bugfest that isn't scary a little fucking bit. I'm writing down this review because i'm so fucking frustrated, i had to reload my saves 5 times just because some of the puzzles became corrupted for no fucking reason. I looked up on the internet and yeah this game does have problems without solutions. That aside, the game itself is NOT scary, some dogs with cancer tissues and spiders are supposed to scare me off? I couldn't even finish the game because of the fucking glitches! No matter what i did i couldn't interact with the piston controls, before that a door couldn't be opened. And i finished %80 of the game at that time. The story isn't good, the gameplay is your general shitty Frictional Games gameplay, the graphics are meh, aaaand this game is NOT SCARY! Don't fucking play this game, you can do anything more fun and productive than playing this garbage. I just wasted my hours trying to finish this shit. | Its a very fun horror puzzle game, you can unlock the frame-rate and enable higher resolution by doing some very simple config file adjustments. overall worth the 4-6 hours it'll take you!

While this game has great nostagia and is super fun, the controls are so bad that I can<t in good conscience tell modern gamers to buy it. | Crash-tastic! 

My memory of this game, of playing it off a CD, is that you could read an entire comic book waiting for a new level to load. Unfortunately that's the part of the game that has been preserved here. Bugs galore, including having actions edge off screen and characters 'dropping' through buildings making them unmovable or un-engagable. What was fun about this game originally was the campy concept and bright colors. It doesn't look right now. The bright colors and comic book dashes and dots with this early animation style doesn't scream page-turning immersive world. It's like a cheap, superficial game you'd get on a cellphone. 

The missions can be painfully simplistic and there isn't a sense of team building or world building. Your reward is largely your own imagination as you earn enough to unlock 'sets' of abilities or skills. If you're someone who wants the nostalgia either from the original release or from the really, really old comics, this might scratch the itch. If you have even slightly high standards informed by modern games, you'll be disappointed. 

The idea that something this simplistic came out in the same era as the Halo games or even the early Civilization games is a little shocking to contemplate. The people who designed it loved Patriot City and some of the 1980's kind of super villain tropes. They had fun with this, clearly, I just don't think it aged well and given the depth of both missions and conceptual design of other early 2000's games I remain shocked it was ever reviewed and ranked so highly. 

I guess get it if it's on sale or you're really, really curious about what people did when they weren't playing Quake back in the day.

Game Name: Freedom Force vs. the Third Reich
Reviews:
Лучшая игра по комиксам евер.
Сейчас бы продолжение с современными технологиями и графикой, эх!

Trine - первая игра в серии с одноименным названием. Жанр игры называется 2.5д, потому что все объекты в приницпе 3д, но при этом угол обзора дается только через бок, но это не мешает игре быть веселой и занимательной. Каждая игра выходит в промежуток в 4 года, кроме 3 частей игры, о которой я напишу позже.

Геймплей: мы играем за трех персонажей сразу и просто переключаемся между ними, чтобы сражаться или решать головоломки. Персонажи: Рыцарь Понтий, Воровка Зоя и Волшебник Амадей. Эти трое были зачарованы магическим артефактом под названием Trine, и теперь игроку предстоит разузнать что это за артефакт и как перестать быть связанным с персонажами.

Кооператив: в игре присутствует кооп режим, который я не пробовал, но людям, которым нравятся играть в одиночку, проходить игру будет удобно.

Кол-во ачивок - 33 (легкие); кол-во карточек - 8. | 6.5/10 還算很有意思的小遊戲，可以全程跟朋友連線(最多三名玩家)!! 可以趁特價買起來玩:)
 | Trine is a bit old but the visuals are still amazing. Played through with my gf and we had loads of laughs and good times. | 很难想象这居然是10多年前的游戏质量，无论是音乐，画质，建模，游戏性简直都太棒了，一个个充满着制作者巧妙布局的关卡，配合上唯美而又动听的音乐，美轮美奂的场景和惊奇的宝物道具，轻松而又惬意的剧情，虽然过程不长，但是依然能感受到创作者在里面投入的心血，感谢你们让我体验到了一个魔幻而又充满搞笑气氛的奇幻史诗世界！10分！ | Beautiful visuals combined with quirky characters, great score and a nice combination of puzzles and 2D combat.

Game Name: Time Gentlemen, Please! and Ben There, Dan That! Special Edition  Double Pack
Reviews:
Exzellente kleine Point & Clicks. Präsentation nicht das Gelbe vom Ei aber der Humor hat mich begeistert. | steam thinks i played these for almost 72 hours for some reason. 

10/10

Game Name: Time Gentlemen, Please! and Ben There, Dan That! Special Edition  Double Pack
Reviews: old old old school point and click. SCUMM style very stupid quite funny lots of day of the manic mansion, early Lucasart point and clicks. With all the pixial  hunting and strange logic. Sequel is the better of the two pack because better story but more frustrating Adventure game logic.

Игру делали гении-психопаты-садисты при этом куря ОГРОМНОЕ КОЛИЧЕСТВО ДУРИ
Если дать самой умной нейронке пройти эту игру, то все её сервера сгорят к ипене матери.
КАЖДАЯ головоломка, РЕАЛЬНАЯ ломает тебе голову, заставляя тебя думать на 200000%
Если ты прошел всю игру без внутреннего гайда, БРАТАН, МОЖЕШЬ СМЕЛО ИДТИ РАБОТАТЬ В НАСА, ибо только СВЕРХЧЕЛОВЕК на такое способен.
Я не удивлен почему я в детстве её не прошел, ОНА НЕ ДЛЯ ДЕТЕЙ, ВООБЩЕ НИКАК НЕТ
Не обманывайтесь милыми роботами, и прекрасной будто вручную, нарисованную цветными карандашами стилистикой, это игра абсолютное преступление против твоих мозговых клеток
Берите и играйте в неё с удовольствием, абсолютно легендарное произведение | Классная игра, наверное одна из лучших игр - головоломок. Vous pensez que ce jeu n'est pas intéressant, n'est-ce pas ? Et bien détrompez vous !

[h1] Découvrir une autre culture[/h1]

Rares sont les jeux  dépaysant, offrant une autre culture en guise de terrain de jeu. C'est pourtant ce que fait ce petit Metroïdvania en nous proposant d'incarner, non pas un chevalier médiéval ou un soldat des guerres modernes, mais un héros du peuple Aztèque, et plus précisément Huitzilo le fils du soleil et son acolyte Ayohpa le colibri dans leurs quêtes pour retrouver un artefact dérobé dans le grand temple. 

Certes le scénario peut sembler simpliste, mais sa véritable richesse ne peut être appréciée qu'au travers des nombreux pnj et de la vie qu'offre la ville et ses villageois. Il est aussi à noter les nombreuses sous quêtes qui offriront un tout autre chemin pour peu qu'on prenne le temps de les faire.

[h1] Et les graphismes alors ? [/h1]

Je n'ai pas grand chose à dire là dessus si ce n'est que, s'est beau, voire très beau, pour peu qu'on aime le style. Les dessins sont très bien détaillés et offrent une vraie vision de ce qu'aurait pu être une véritable ville Aztèque d'époque ainsi que de ses environs. Qui plus est, les tableaux sont magnifiques, on prend plaisir à explorer chacune des zones que propose l'aventure. 

[h1] L'interactif ? [/h1]

Pour ce qui est du gameplay, nous avons là un métroïdvania allant emprunter quelques petits trucs aux jeux de rôles, allant jusqu'à impliquer le joueur par son utilisation de la souris pour intéragir directement avec le décor et ainsi dégager un chemin pour ses personnages. Il offre ainsi ses propres nouveautés et sa propre petite touche personnelle. Voici une petite liste de ce qui est intéressant dans ce titre:

- [b]La magie:[/b] 
[i]Lorsque l'on est rejoint par son petit compagnon, on obtient alors la possibilité de lancer des sorts. Le système utilisé est assez intéressant. Le jeu propose d'incanter celui-ci au moyen d'un petit jeu de vitesse, en cliquant sur de petites cibles apparaissant à l'écran près de la créature ciblée.[/i] 

- [b]L'équipement:[/b]
 [i]Outre les objets trouvés en cours d'aventure, il sera possible d'acheter ou de gagner sur les monstres divers objets afin d'équiper nos deux héros, et ainsi renforcer leurs statistiques.[/i]

-  [b]Les essences magiques:[/b]
 [i]Les monstres lâcheront souvent une petite brume d'énergie de diverses couleurs. Il sera possible au cours de l'aventure de stocker la dite énergie afin de l'utiliser pour modifier le décor en faisant apparaitre des plateformes ou de l'utiliser pour ouvrir les passages. [/i]

- [b]Pas de game over:[/b]
 [i]Comme beaucoup de jeux récents il n'y aura pas de game over, et le personnage réapparaîtra à l'entrée de la zone où il se trouvait ou pour les trous, sur l'autre versant du trou. Cela pourrait rebuter ceux aimant le chalenge et la difficulté, mais ceux voulant s'essayer au genre prendront plaisir à découvrir ce titre.[/i]

- [b]Les compétences passives:[/b]
 [i]Bien qu'elles soient peu nombreuses les compétences passives joueront leurs rôles soit en boostant le soin, soit en améliorant la qualité de l'armure pouvant être portée ou tout simplement en augmentant les dégâts infligés par la magie.[/i]

[h1] Bon jeu ou pas ? [/h1]

Eh bien pour ma part, j'estime que le jeu vaut le coup de se laisser tenter, ne serait-ce que pour en découvrir un peu plus sur le peuple aztèque et leur Culture, Le gameplay quant à lui bien qu'intéressant sera surtout apprécié par les novices, la difficulté étant peu présente. | 看了下发行日期，在STEAM上是09年发行的，也许实际上游戏出来更早一点也说不定。
那么，作为一款这么OLD的游戏，此游戏的品质如何呢？也许主角跑了这么多年已经跑得没有香港记者快了，但是就按照这个游戏打折的时候才3元的价格来说，即使放在今天这个游戏的可玩性还是高过其定价的，甚至比美国的华莱士还高。
怎样的一款游戏会带给人享受呢，私以为，所谓 “游戏”必须要有代入感，而这个游戏成功的做到了能将人代入其中。那么他是怎么做到的呢？
首先音乐，熏吹奏的背景音乐饱含原始的悠扬和狂野，（强烈建议出SOUND DLC听不腻！）然后是画面，2D的平面画风很细腻，山是山，水是水，虽然没有立体成像，没有细致的特效和光照，不过却朴实的恰到好处。[spoiler]作为阿兹特克的神话传说，不就该这么古朴吗[/spoiler]，最后是故事情节和游戏玩法。网上并没有找到可用的中文，所以我是一个个单词翻译着来玩的。剧情[spoiler]大概故事就是主角是太阳神的后裔，在世界危难之际，打败邪恶的大反派BALABALA之类的典型的上古传说[/spoiler]
玩法上还是挺不错的。如果GTA5叫作“三男一狗”，那么这个游戏就叫[spoiler]“一男一鸟”[/spoiler]好了。主人公作为半神，不同于一般那种主角刚开始很残疾然后慢慢成长每次依赖主角光环惊险的击败敌人并且敌人每次派一个炮灰的俗套，强大的无愧于半神的后裔。他掌控的各种元素之力很有趣，也很给力。这里就不剧透了。
游戏有一点解谜元素，还有ARPG元素，属性点可以自由分配，还有不同的技能可以用。装备也是很多的。各个地图之间也可以自由来回去，刷东西的。虽然不如现在的一些ARPG那么丰富，但是却很符合其作为一个小品作的身份，精简朴实的恰到好处。

缺点：1没有卡。没有官中。文本不算多，但是场景很多还是用对话来交待剧情的，所以不懂的人会错过一些东西。
          2内容完全可以再扩展些的，并在此基础上出联机模式，和创意工坊
          3掌握了套路，基本都能过去，不过这也是大部分ARPG的通病了，刷刷刷才是ARPG的主题。 | Was really hoping I won't have to give this game a thumbs down, but I just can't recommend it. It's not a bad game at all. The visuals are stunning and the music is pretty great, and together they give each location a nice atmosphere. There are also some interesting ideas, like the way the skill levelling is handled, as well as your familiar being in charge of magic and levelling magic stats, whereas you only level up the brawn attributes.

The combat is very so-so. You learn some nice new moves along the way, such as being able to hurt enemies whilst performing air flips, but overall it's very tedious and most enemies seem to be damage sponges that take forever to die, not to mention shrugging off your hits whilst you're attacking them, meaning you'll always be getting hit back whilst attacking.

And as you go, you keep meeting the same 2-3 enemies per area again and again and again. Eventually you stop fighting them and just flip over them, because some of the latter levels are just way too long and convoluted. I got fed up when I ended up in some ant cave full of giant ants everywhere. The level went on forever and I just kept getting lost, and when I died, I'd just start back in it because the game autosaved (and you can't save manually). So I'm essentially stuck there and can't go back.

It's really a shame, because some other levels, like Ehecalk Temple, were designed pretty well and were fun to explore. It's as if the devs ran out of ideas at some point and just started throwing in really long and repetitive levels with dozens of enemies everywhere.

I also don't quite understand some of the enemy choices. Whereas Jaguar warriors and haunted masks were quite fitting to the Aztec setting, on the other hand Centauri were out of place. 

Don't expect to find much of a story in the game either. Although it starts as though you're on someone's trail, eventually it just boils down to "go and collect these 7 phonograms all over the world".

Overall I am quite disappointed. It started off as a promising game, but then lost its footing very quickly and turned into a very average sidescroller with gameplay issues. If you're really curious to try the game still, I'd suggest to just get it when it's on sale. | Доброго времени суток, друзья! Поиграл тут в "Aztaka" и получил хорошие впечатления. Начнём с сюжета, который завязан на мифологии индейского племени Ацтеков. Реализована эта мифология вполне неплохо. Дизайн уровней,   имена и вещи, всё пронизано духом ацтекской культуры. Вы берёте на себя роль двух персонажей. Избранного воина Уицило, сына Солнца, и его помощника, проклятого волшебника  Айохпа, принявшего образ колибри. Их цель, это найти артефакт, украденный из великого храма. На этом и построен сюжет.

[h1] Геймплей: [/h1]
Геймплей разнообразен и сочетает в себе несколько аспектов. В первую очередь, это платформер\метроидвания. Перемещаетесь по локациям, осваивате навыки, которые помогут достичь ранее недоступных мест.
Боевая система развивается по мере прохождения игры. Воин отвечает непосредственно на физическое противостояние с врагами. Но начинаете он своё путешествие только с одним копьём и не имеете никаких способностей. Его единственная атака, это бросаться вперед копьем. Он так же, может делать кувырок, но он не особо спасает, так как урон вы получаете не только от атак противников, но и просто коснувшись их. Позже станут доступны и другие атаки (удар вверх, позволяющий атаковать врагов в воздухе, или удар прыжком, наносящим урон врагам).

Колибри же отвечает за магическую составляющую. Он может  использовать защитные и атакующие заклинания. Щит и относительно слабый магический снаряд - ваше главное магическое оружие. Интересно выполнение заклинаний. Выглядит это как некая скоростная мини-игра. Выбираете заклинание и нажимаете на поля, которые появляются на экране, чтобы завершить заклинание. Чем сложнее заклинание, тем больше кликов требуется. 

Оба героя постепенно  повышают свой уровень и становятся сильнее, приобретая новые навыки. Взаимодействие героев органично сочетается между собой, и с окружающим их миром. К примеру, в самом начале игры вы можете вырастить ветки на определенных деревьях, что открывает дальнейший маршрут. А чтобы взаимодействовать с окружающим миром, нужно применять энергетические сферы четырёх видов, которые будете или находить просто на уровнях или, после гибели противников. Каждая из них будет помогать преодолевать определенные препятствия.

Во время приключений наши герои так же будут находить различные предметы экипировки, повышающей их параметры. А так же, будут зарабатывать очки опыта и повышать свой уровень. А с помощью найденных артефактов увеличивать свое здоровье и ману. К тому же, у наших героев есть пассивные навыки, как в классических ролевых играх (сила, ловкость и т.д.), которые так же будут прокачиваться по мере прохождения.

[h1] Визуал и музыка: [/h1] 
Графика поразительно красива и детализирована. Локации подробно прорисованы и отлично передают дух некогда великой культуры. Саундтреки великолепны и отлично вписываются в игру.

[h1] Вердикт: [/h1]
Игра мне понравилась. Хороший, добротный платформер, сочетающий в себе элементы RPG и метроидвании, с красивой графикой и обворожительной музыкой. Хорошее приключение, которое стоит пережить. | 横版过关游戏
WSAD移动，左键交互，右键攻击
其中左键是个重点，后面会在相当多的地方用到
1.每次切换地图后自动保存，在探索时无法手动保存
2.游戏关键点事需要注意的是地图里的绿色光球（生命能量）、白色光球（神圣能量）、蓝色光球，可以用左键点击交互操作
可以拖拽到地图上的闪光点（鼠标移上去的时候会提示需要哪种能量）完成交互
比如生命能量拖到树上的闪光点可以让树长出枝干，游戏开始往右走到瀑布前，就需要这样子做通过引导
3.随着主线任务推进，可以直接把生命能量拖到自己或关键NPC的身上治疗
治疗对主角可以恢复一定量的生命
4.主线任务初期给个收集生命能量的罐子，可以存放一定数量的生命能量
地图到达地下通道（第四张大地图，The Underground Passage）时可以拾取一个存放圣神能量的罐子
5.技能类似于QTE操作释放，如果是给自己jiabuff的，直接点击下方的技能（比如1），人物身边会出现技能图标，依次点击后即可释放
如果是对敌人的技能，则需要按下技能后（比如技能2），再点击怪物，然后同样会在怪物身边会出现技能图标，在规定时间内按顺序点击
技能伤害前期还是挺可观的，前期什么点数都不加的时候，攻击怪物才5点左右伤害，一个技能2可以有6、70点伤害
6.初期遇到被用黑暗能量控制的怪物，杀死后过一段时间就会复活
这个时候需要用生命能量救助他们，才能解除控制
7.第四张地图开始会有一些小BOSS出现，难度都不高，躲避对方的攻击然后找机会放技能，成功放个十次左右就能击杀
8.属性点，对主角和精灵都是有3种属性点
分别是攻击伤害、暴击率、生命值（魔法值）上限
其中Endurance和Faith的数值是乘法计算
比如你现在有5个生命格，5点Endurance，那么你的生命上限就是5X5=25，效果还是挺明显的
属性点每级可以获得1点，各种装备也可以增加，但最重要的来源应该算是药水
这些药水可以在击杀怪物时小几率掉落，中期做完巫医萨满的任务后可以花200货币购买，貌似无限
所以只要花时间杀怪，一定会变强的

A few mild RPG elements to round off the fantasy setting and a little more combat helps set this apart.  There are some audio problems and janky controls, but I never found them to be to annoying.

Saving the world? That's boring. Playing an evil lord and parodying the fantasy genre is much more fun.

In Overlord 2, you will try out the role of the new Dark Lord, with whom you will set out to plunder the land and spread evil. Mainly with the help of your chatty and tireless goblin minions.

From the cold glacial cave, your heavy steps will lead you through snowy gorges and along the way you will sow destruction and death around you. Then comes the tropical land of the annoying marijuana elves and their annoying dances. We will also go to the underworld to the dark land of the old, already defeated dark lord. And finally, we will go to massacre the land of our archenemy - the Roman Empire led by Emperor Solarius.
The game takes place in relatively large levels, which are visually very variable and offer constant enjoyment. Although it is a more or less linear experience, it at least gives a sense of freedom.

Overlord II is a successful sequel to the first game. Although there could be at least one new goblin class and more frequent saves. [b] 55% [/b] | Amazing game, a true classic. I still hold onto hope that a new one will be released one day. | This game is really fun, but I can't recommend it because the Battle Rock DLC was never released for PC, and without that DLC you can't max out your character.

I doubt that will ever change, but if it does I'll update my review. | Overlord 1 & Raising Hell DLC is absolutely better, which is a shame.

You could tell the Devs just didn't get to finish Overlord 2, especially at the end siege. Overlord 1 & Raising Hell DLC lasted me over 40+ hours, yet Overlord 2 wasn't even 20 hours.

Worth a single play through, but absolutely not something I see myself playing again.

Odd, Overlord Dark Legend came out the exact same day & year, yet scored better overall compared to Overlord 2 - will have to try that someday. | Made back when western video games could still have attractive female characters.

Уникальная игра, с интересными идеями как в геймплее, так и в сюжете, а так же с худшей технической реализацией из возможных. One of those puzzle games, cute and cuddly on the outside, but with hardcore brain-metling levels by the end of the game.
The difficulty curve is quite smooth and balanced - levels in the middle are very pleasant to go through.

The strategy is quite deep and not immediately obvious. You can't expect to jump in and play it well without first learning how the game works. Once you understand the mechanics though, it's easy enough to play, but not so easy to win! I must admit, when I read the other reviews, I was shocked to see so many negative comments, which is why I felt compelled to add this review of my own. Looking at those reviews, I noticed that many of them were by people who haven't put many hours into the game. Since it takes quite a while to master, I suspect that a lot of the negativity came from not playing it long enough to figure out the best strategies.

I'd like to address some of the points made in other reviews:

Overly complicated - Yes, it seems that way at first, there is a bit of a learning curve involved, but it's not that hard once you get used to it. The in-game help tells you all you need to know, you just need to take the trouble to read it. As for "ridiculously complicated" units with many different abilities, that's a good thing. It creates a lot of variety in the game, making the strategy more complex and interesting.

Trouble Man said that the game doesn't explain the number crunching, but it does. When in battle, there's a small arrow underneath Projected Health. Click this and it shows you the Damage Calculations. All the modifiers are listed to help you understand exactly what's going on in the battle.

Luck not Strategy - Not true! Sure, there's a lot of luck in which cards you draw, but hey, it's a card game, that's kind of the whole point! But once you've drawn your cards, what you do with them is pure strategy. There's nothing random in the combat calculations, it depends entirely on which cards are played. Of course, you don't know what cards the computer will play during the battles, but that's not luck, it's making strategic choices based on the cards it has available.

Just as the computer can ruin your attack by playing a powerful card, you can do exactly the same if you have one. Choosing which cards to play and which to save until later is a big part of the strategy. Tip: make feint attacks with unimportant units to force the computer to waste valuable cards, then make your important attacks with your best cards later, once the computer is out of good cards to defend with.

Another important aspect of the strategy are terrain effects and unit special abilities. Place units on tiles they gain an advantage on, not on ones that give them a disadvantage. Surround enemy units to gain support advantages. Capture many tiles quickly to increase your mana generation. There's loads of strategic possibilities on the battlefield.

Hard AI, scenarios stacked against you - This is true. It's not an easy game, but if it were then it wouldn't be much of a challenge. It's a pity there aren't more easy scenarios or different difficulty levels to make it easier for new players, but that's just the way it is. It may seem daunting at first, but it gets easier once you figure out the best strategies. People often criticise the AI for being too easy in many games, so it makes a nice change that this AI offers a hard challenge. If that scares you, then don't buy it, but if you love a hard strategical challenge, this may be for you.

Turn limits - Some people don't like this, but again, it's all part of the challenge. If you had unlimited turns it would make the game too easy. You'd just grab most of the tiles, get most of the mana and simply out-produce the AI. Besides, many people complain about the slow turns, so do you really want the game to go on for even longer?

Slow Turns - True, this can be annoying. I wish there were a way of speeding them up. But it's not the end of the world. You can always watch TV or do something else while the AI is taking its turn, or check your Facebook page, or whatever...

Story? What story? This is a strategy game! Who cares about story! :-)

Some reviewers compared the game to Magic the Gathering. Why? Because it's a fantasy game and it has cards? As I see it, this game is nothing like MtG, the game mechanics are completely different. IMO, this is more of a turn based strategy game than a card game. If MtG is what you are expecting, think again.

Saint Killjoy said "don't ignore the bad reviews, they were given for a reason" - That sounds fair enough, but I suspect that the two main reasons for the bad reviews are:

1. Having the wrong expectations about the game - perhaps thinking it will be like MtG, or thinking it will be easy because it's a card game. Don't buy it based on what you think or hope it will be like, buy it based on what it is. Check out some YouTube videos first.

2. Not playing it for long enough to figure out the best strategies. Yes it's hard, but you shouldn't give up too easily or pass judgement too soon. Good strategy games often take a long time to master.

My advice would be this: Make up your own mind about this game based on the kind of games that YOU like to play, not on the opinions of others who often have different tastes in games.

I'm not saying that everyone should like and buy this game. I'm sure that there are many people who would hate it. But for those that enjoy challenging turn based strategy against a hard AI, with some card based randomness thrown in, I highly recommend it. Just be sure that you know what you're letting yourself in for.

For the current sale price, it's a no brainer IMO. And even if you don't like it, you won't have lost much. But if you do buy it, make sure to buy both DLCs as well. There are only 9 maps in the base game. The DLCs add another 16 maps (some of which generate random terrain) and two more guardians, providing a lot more replayability.

To sum up:

PROS:
Challenging and deep turn based strategy.
Huge variety of special abilities.
Card based randomness ensures that every game is different.
Battles are quite hard.

CONS:
Gameplay seems a bit complex at first.
It takes a while to figure out the best strategies.
Slow AI turns.
Battles are quite hard. | Some interesting concepts here but it doesn't come together for a fun experience. To fix resolution go into local files for the game, select the bin folder, then right click "stranger.exe". Click on properties, then compatibility and select "override high DPI scaling behaviour" then when booting up the game set it to 1600x900.

For controller support, disable steam input.

Thank you, Zachtronics, for making such an amazing game. This is not a Sudoku or Sokoban where there is exactly one perfectly-logical solution to each puzzle. Instead, each player invents their own solutions -- and some can be more efficient than others, in multiple mutually-exclusive ways. As Zach Barth said in old interviews, SpaceChem is an example of "design-based games, which present you with a goal, perfect information, and a set of combinable tools to achieve it... they're essentially asking you to 'invent' a solution to a problem instead of merely 'finding' the solution." This kind of creative puzzle-solving is what I had imagined a STEM PhD program would be like (though it turns out PhDs are not really mostly about this; but that's a whole other story).

And... after a decade and a half, HOLY COW I finally beat it! Without hints**! I know many others have beat it before me, but it's still satisfying to know I've done something SpaceChem's designer Zach Barth has (according to old interviews) never done himself.

WOW has this ever been a long journey. These little molecules and waldos have accompanied me like a white whale through so many life stages. When SpaceChem came out in 2011, I started playing the game and enjoyed it a ton, but I got stuck and took a break. A few years later, I picked it up again as a distraction from grad school, but only reached the 4th or 5th world out of 9 -- before taking another (loooong) break. A decade later, after getting tenure, my treat to myself was to tackle SpaceChem seriously again... and now it's finally done -- with my kids staying up late to cheer as we beat the final boss.

Looking at the Steam-friends leaderboards, I'm also amused to see where my friends apparently quit playing. The quantum-physics PhD tunneled out in the 3rd world; the Twitch data scientist stopped streaming in the 5th; the software engineer and the IT manager suffered packet loss in the 6th. Somehow, I alone persevered to traverse the desolate worlds 7 through 9. Steam says I've spent 60ish hours on the game; I'd guess around 30 hours covered the first 6 worlds and the other 30 hours covered the last 3 worlds. Many of my solutions aren't optimized and beautiful (especially Don't Fear The Reaper; holy crap I made an ugly mess there) -- but they are mine, my own inventions, my hard-fought victories.

Once again, thank you to Zach and Zachtronics.

* The minor exceptions to fairness: (1) Every non-boss level tells you exactly how many molecules you need to make, but the boss-levels don't. It can be orders of magnitude harder to devise a solution that'll use up all molecules equally and produce an unending stream of hits, vs a good-enough solution that's unbalanced but just enough to beat the boss... yet you don't know how many hits each boss will take until you beat it. Most take around 3 hits -- but not all. (2) The game doesn't seem to allow multiple save slots for a level. If I try one solution and it doesn't QUITE work and I want to try another one, I have to get rid of my first solution and start the second... and if the second fails, I can't revert back to the first. I could take a screenshot of an initial solution, then remake it from scratch later if I need to, but aaargh! This is a small but extremely frustrating flaw in the game's interaction design. HOWEVER, I didn't realize until after beating the game that there's a dev-authorized "community edition" beta version which DOES allow multiple save slots per level. Look it up. Argh.

** "I beat it, without hints": Ok, technically, for the very last 2 boss levels I eventually looked up how many hits it takes to defeat each boss. See above -- I think this is unfair imperfect information. Besides, all the earlier bosses die after around 3 hits, but these two didn't die after 3... nor after 4... so I gave in and looked it up, because there's a big difference between "incrementally tweak my initial solution to stretch from 3 hits to 5 or 6 hits" vs "start again from scratch to allow for 10 or 20 or 40 hits." But I didn't look at anyone else's solutions, merely the number of hits required. | Great puzzle game, challenging and engaging! | I'm wondering why I'm playing this game, is it any different than going to github and submitting a feature? | This is a game made for people with massive brains.

Está bien, es un juego de ciencia ficción sobre un barco que se hunde con una técnica decentemente competente para un motor de física acuático:  el gran protagonista es el agua.

La aventura se desarrolla en un gran barco llamado" Reina del Mundo", pero es invadido por un grupo de terroristas llamados" Neo maltusianos" liderados por Mila. Estos quieren reducir la población matando personas sistemáticamente y robar tecnología para convertirlas en armas.
La ingeniera de sistema Kate Wilson se ve inmersa en la batalla por la supervivencia, pero finalmente decide descubrir el complot terrorista y salvar a los pasajeros de la nave mientras este se va hundiendo.

Mientras el océano se precipita alrededor, Kate deberá lidiar con el flujo masivo de agua que nos dificultarán o impedirán directamente el avance. Kate hara uso de buenas habilidades acrobáticas para escalar por superficies elevadas y acceder a zonas fuera de las indundaciones, resolver fáciles acertijos y utilizar un dispositivo portátil para hackear códigos para abrir puertas o acceder a camaras de seguridad, además hará uso de una mediocre arma de fuego con diferentes tipos de munición y al final con un poder para provocar grandes olas que desestabilicen a los enemigos

Veamos "hidrofobia" entendí por el título que la protagonista presenta un miedo irracional al agua, bien, esto se manifiesta en el juego cuando Kate está sumergida en el agua con la inquietante voz de ella cuando era una niña, estos sonidos se presentan solo en los momentos tensos, pero nada más, luego en el resto de la aventura parece estar muy cómoda atravesando las inundaciones...

El juego es divertido de jugar, cuenta con 42 desafíos y 72 coleccionables, además de 13 logros Steam para desbloquear.
Dejando de lado la ingeniosa física del agua, te recordará un poco a juegos como Tomb Raider, pero con tiroteos pobres, un poco lineal, muy corto de duración y malas secciones de acertijos, además posee un modo desafío que consiste en resistir durante 5 rondas contra grupos de terroristas.
Recomiendo agarrarlo en alguna oferta de Steam | If you can find this on a deep sale, the gameplay is clunky but fun. I really enjoyed how much of a factor water physics played in this game. | An interesting game.
Built, and hyped, purely on its water physics engine Hydrophobia is an action adventure a la Tomb Raider or Uncharted although on a much smaller scale.
This is and always will be, the first episode of a planned trilogy.
Which is why the game ends abruptly on a cliffhanger.

The graphics are actually pretty decent for such an old game and definitely portrays the almost hard sci-fi I feel they were going for quite well. The environments have that clean sci-fi look that production designers like to think the future will be like.
The 'star' of the game is obviously the water, which again for the time is very impressive.
Actually, although many games since have included some type of water physics I don't know if any of them improved on this particular type. A lot of games have neat effects like the Spintires series and such, but Hydrophobia has water flowing from rooms with more water in them to rooms with less through doors and windows which I think is very different from the smaller scale water physics whereby it only interacts with objects. 
It reminds me a bit of the physics in pixel games like Clonk and Noita.
The water is fairly gelatinous though.

Sorry I went on a bit of a tangent there.
The audio is good enough.
Guns sound a bit weak and there isn't a lot of music, but it's all serviceable.
The voice acting except for the protagonist is also acceptable IMO.

The core gameplay is not bad, but the jank of the controls makes it a bit annoying at times.
Sometimes your character won't jump, or grab onto a ledge and the 'super power' system is terrible.
Which is a minor issue since you only get your power in the last five minutes of the game, but it does make the boss fight more frustrating than it needed to be.
The basic gameplay loop consists of running/swimming/climbing around until you get to a locked door, find the two parts of the key and go to the next section to repeat everything. With the occasional simple cover shooter combat inbetween.

Would I recommend it?
It's often on sale for less than 50 cents and for that price, it's certainly an interesting forgotten game.
And well, I still wouldn't recommend it really but it'll keep you busy and mildly entertained for a few hours.
If Steam had an actual rating system I'd say it's a 6.5/10 or 3/5. | Aesthetically it's a 10/10. The enviroments look really nice and the water physics are great. Gameplay-wise it's more of a 6.8/10.

很好的Terraria,使我童年旋转。
差不多7年前，我的小学同学就发现了这款大作，那时手机版还没有心动，只有应用商店里的1.2版本，对于当时的我们，手机版1.2只有两个滑轮键控制移动和瞄准，并且局域网联机方便，十分益于上手。我和几个哥们一放假就聚在一起play。当时我们卡在世纪之花这个boss，就聚在学校小花园商量战术，没想到我自己直接单挑过了，还有我第一次打过肉山，是拿蜜蜂手雷和它同归于尽，真的很怀念1.2陪伴我的时光，之后1.2下架，国服代理，为了玩上1.3的泰拉，我在好游快爆苦苦地种玉米（当时可以以此换取游玩资格，否则就要花钱），没想到最后发现还需要早起抢购资格，而我当时可能在上学，没有抢到，努力直接白费。我和同学只能在网上寻找那些还没下架1.2的网站继续玩。
从小学到了初中，以前玩泰拉的朋友各奔东西，但我对泰拉的热情依然不减，后来出了手游国际版我便立即下载，顶着看不懂的英文，摸索1.3的机制，专家模式掉落的装备我都从未见过，新鲜感和好奇心油然而生，初中期间我也找到了一两个一起玩的，使我不至于太孤独。疫情之前，我从来都是只玩手机版泰拉，知道疫情上网课，我终于有机会玩上电脑版了。当时的我对电脑并不精通，也不知道steam是什么东西，于是就在360浏览器直接搜泰拉瑞亚，经过一天的寻找，我也是下到了盗版泰拉（当时我也不知道正版要买）就这么在电脑上再通关了一遍普通模式，但这次没有任何人陪伴，只有我一个人。
终于到了高中，我了解了正规的steam渠道，在打折期间花18块钱买了正版泰拉，为童年补了票，高二认识了几个志同道合的同学，一起玩了灾厄，也是乐在其中。如今，我即将成人，步入大学生活，但我的泰拉之旅还在继续，玩了十几年游戏，只有泰拉瑞亚给我的印象最深，给我带来的乐趣最多，对于陪伴了我78年的老伙计，打多少星已经不重要了，真没想到我能写这么多，回顾了一遍我的童年，我的眼里有些模糊。 | --{ Gráficos }---
